business.headline: Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT, pharma stocks drag marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex shed 291.20 points to 75,676.19, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 88.65 points to 22,856.65 as of 9:25 AM.

Quality Power IPO: Check allotment status, latest GMP and listing date Quality Power IPO allotment status: Investors who applied for the Quality Power IPO can check their allotment status through the BSE website or the registrar's website (Link Intime India Private Ltd).

Elon Musk's Tesla hunts for land in India, Maharashtra leads: ReportWhile Maharashtra is leading the race, other states are also vying for the project. Tesla's plans could change depending on the incentives offered by different states.

Unified Pension Scheme to roll out from April 1. Check eligibility and benefitsUnder the new pension scheme, government employees will contribute 10% of their basic salary along with DA, while the government's contribution will rise from the previous 14% to 18.5%.

ELSS explained: Check tax benefits under Section 80C and other key details ELSS offers market-linked returns and has the potential to generate higher long-term returns as compared to other Section 80C options, including PPF, ULIPS, and NPS, etc.

Trump's reciprocal tariffs could hurt Indian exports. Which sectors are at risk?While officials are still waiting for details on how these tariffs will be calculated, they are already preparing countermeasures and working on a trade deal proposal to reduce tariffs and boost two-way trade.

Sensex, Nifty bounce back from day's low to close flat; IT stocks lead recoveryThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 29.47 points to close at 75,967.39, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 14.20 points to end at 22,945.30.

Want to save taxes? Try these 5 last-minute investment options to maximise benefitsThe Equity-Linked Savings Scheme (ELSS) is a popular tax-saving tool available under Section 80C, offering a lock-in period of three years. Under this, investments up to Rs 1.5 lakh are eligible for deductions.

Sugar gets costlier: Prices rise 6.5% in a month as output dipsSugar price hike: A drop in sugar output, caused by adverse weather and the reopening of sugar exports after two years, has led to a supply shortage, pushing up prices.

New Income Tax Bill: Will taxpayers with late ITR filings lose refunds?Late ITR filing refund concern: The Income Tax Act, 1961, does not prevent taxpayers from claiming a refund just because the return was filed after the deadline.

Licious, backed by Temasek, preps for massive $2 billion IPO: Report Delightful Gourmet Pvt, the parent company of Licious, is expanding its physical store network and improving delivery times to compete with quick-commerce rivals.

Smallcap stocks are bleeding. What should investors do?Smallcap stocks have been battered by the persistent selling by foreign institutional investors (FIIs). A dismal Q3 earnings season has only worsened the situation.

entertainment.headline: Retro hits to soulful music: Magical evening at Papon's Valentine's Day special showPapon's concert in Delhi, hosted by TV9, was an unforgettable night filled with soulful music. Held at Major Dhyan Chand National Stadium, the event was part of the World Travel and Tourism Festival.

Watch: Arijit Singh attends father's video call during live concertArijit Singh's live concert in Chandigarh was made memorable by a surprise video call from his father during his performance. The singer shared heartfelt moments from the event on Instagram, expressing gratitude to his fans.

Pics: Singer Anuv Jain married, shares photos with wifeSinger Anuv Jain, popular for songs like Baarishein, is now married. He shared photos from the wedding and pre-wedding festivities on social media.

Singer Akhil Sachdeva on Diljit Dosanjh's infrastructure remark: I feel it's amazingSinger Akhil Sachdeva discusses the rise of concerts in India, film vs indie music, ticket prices, and Diljit Dosanjh's comments on concert infrastructure. He also stresses the importance of crediting technicians.

K-slate 2025: When Life Gives You Tangerine to Wife of a 21st Century PrinceKakao Entertainment is set to make 2025 a landmark year for K-dramas and films, with a rich array of releases across various genres. From gripping thrillers to heartwarming romances, the lineup promises stellar performances and captivating stories.

Dabba Cartel trailer: Shabana Azmi, Jyotika promise an addictive showThe trailer for Netflix's Dabba Cartel unveils a gripping crime drama about five women whose dabba business unexpectedly plunges them into the dangerous world of a drug cartel.

Kim Sae-ron's father blames YouTuber for death, co-star Won Bin breaks downSouth Korean actor Kim Sae-ron's father spoke out at her funeral, held a day after her death, highlighting the emotional distress she suffered due to a YouTuber's videos.

Karan Singh Grover back on TV 5 years after Kasautii Zindagii Kay: ReportActor Karan Singh Grover might just be a part of a romantic show very soon. He is reported to be seen alongside Helly Shah in this new TV show.

Late Linkin Park singer Chester Bennington's child comes out as transgenderLinkin Park singer Chester Bennington's child, Draven, has come out as transgender. The artiste shared the news on her social media handle, while stating her preferred pronouns in a small note.

Amit Trivedi: Global artists performing in India is nothing but pure businessIndia has become a hotspot for global artists to perform, drawing big names like Coldplay, Ed Sheeran, and Dua Lipa. Music composer Amit Trivedi believes their choice is driven by business interests, as they seek lucrative opportunities in the country.

Bridgerton 4 first look: Benedict-Sophie's love story takes centre stageThe fourth season of Bridgerton is set to spotlight Benedict Bridgerton's romance with Sophie Baek. New characters like Katie Leung's Lady Araminta Gun will add intrigue to the season.

Legends of Shiva: Amish Tripathi gets real about Lord Shiva in his latest showAuthor and producer Amish Tripathi returns as host of Legends of Shiva with Amish, a new show on Discovery Channel, exploring Lord Shiva beyond myths. Unveiled at the New Delhi Book Fair, it promises a deep dive into mythology coinciding with Maha Kumbh 2025.

general news.headline: I've lot of respect for PM, but why are we giving $21 million to India? TrumpEarlier this week, the Elon Musk-led Department of Government Efficiency announced that it had slashed $723 million in foreign aid funding, including a $21 million grant for India aimed at increasing "voter turnout".

US regulator seeks India's help in Adani bribery case, shows court filing: ReportGautam Adani bribery case: The US Securities and Exchange Commission has requested the Indian government's assistance in its probe of industrialist Gautam Adani and his nephew in connection with a  USD 265 million bribery case, according to a court filing.

Gyanesh Kumar takes charge as new poll body chief, replaces Rajiv KumarFormer bureaucrat Gyanesh Kumar on Wednesday took charge as India's 26th Chief Election Commissioner, succeeding Rajiv Kumar who served in the post for over two years.

US advertises 'cuffs and shackles' treatment for illegal immigrants in videoThe US posted a video showing illegal immigrants in shackles as they prepare them to board a deportation flight in America. The deportation of illegal immigrants comes as part of a sweeping crackdown by President Donald Trump on illegal immigration.

How Diya Kumari's lunch became a talking point on Rajasthan Budget'Green' and 'clean' buzzed as the deputy CM cum finance minister offered broad indicators about her first full-fledged Budget, to be presented on February 19

H-1B visa cost varies for Indians. These factors might push up priceFor Indian professionals dreaming of working in the US, the H-1B visa is the favourite of visas. The H-1B visa involves a lottery system and can cost up to Rs 6.1 lakh. Here's a breakdown of the expense and how much an H-1B visa might cost for an employer and applicant.

Bengaluru man wins case against PVR-INOX for wasting time with 25-min adsA consumer court in Bengaluru ruled in favour of a man who sued PVR Cinemas and INOX for wasting his time with long commercial advertisements. The court also directed the multiplex chain to specify actual movie start times on tickets.

After BJP uproar over Telangana's Ramzan order, similar move by ally in AndhraThe Andhra Pradesh government has allowed Muslim employees to leave work an hour early during Ramzan, days after Telangana's Congress government issued a similar order, which the BJP slammed as "appeasement politics".

How Vicky Kaushal became Chhaava: Sword training, horse riding and daily scarsVicky Kaushal trained for six months for Chhaava, enduring 6–8 hours of daily prep, including sword fighting and horse riding. The historical drama has crossed Rs 165 crore in five days at the box office.

Champions Trophy Live Streaming: When and where to watch matches, full squadsThe Champions Trophy 2025 returns to the cricket calendar after a hiatus of nearly 8 years. Here's everything you need to know about the matches, venues, timings and the squads in the tournament.

Watch: US rapper hugs Rihanna after 'not guilty' verdict in assault caseAfter a three-week trial, the jury deliberated for just three hours to reach the verdict that spared Rocky, whose legal name is Rakim Mayers, a prison sentence that could have run more than two decades.

No cold war: Eknath Shinde rejects reports of rift with Devendra FadnavisMaharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde said there was "absolutely no cold war" between him and Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis.
Guillain-Barré Syndrome can be life-impairing: How to detect, fight the diseaseKey facts about the autoimmune nerve condition that, in severe cases, can even cause paralysis

Videos of women patients at Gujarat maternity hospital leaked, sold on TelegramVideos of women patients at Payal Maternity Hospital were uploaded to a YouTube channel, with access offered via a Telegram link for a fee ranging from Rs 999 to Rs 1,500.

Elon Musk's Tesla hunts for land in India, Maharashtra leads: ReportWhile Maharashtra is leading the race, other states are also vying for the project. Tesla's plans could change depending on the incentives offered by different states.

Fully fit Novak Djokovic handed shock Qatar Open exit by Matteo BerrettiniNovak Djokovic's struggles in 2025 continued as he suffered a shocking Round of 32 defeat to Matteo Berrettini at the Qatar Open. The Italian dominated after a tiebreak first set to claim a 7-6 (4), 6-2 win.

Bharat Jodo Yatra inspired wedding invite takes unity in diversity to next levelA wedding invitation titled 'Bharat Jodo Vivah' celebrating the nuptials of a Jammu-based girl and a Kerala-based boy has warmed the hearts of many social media users. Inspired by Congress's Bharat Jodo Yatra, the card highlights the couple's cultural backgrounds, with personal invitations to Rahul and Priyanka Gandhi.

Supreme Court hearing of pleas on appointment of election commissioners todayThe Supreme Court hearing comes two days after Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar was elevated as the Chief Election Commissioner. His term will run till January 26, 2029, days before the poll body is expected to announce the next Lok Sabha polls.

Champions Trophy FAQs: Your complete guide to the returning mini World Cup Champions Trophy 2025 FAQs: In these 13 FAQs, we have covered everything you need to know about the ICC Champions Trophy 2025, from the schedule and venues to team line-ups and live streaming details. This comprehensive guide ensures you stay informed about all key aspects of the tournament.

Wikipedia gets police notice over 'objectionable' content on Sambhaji MaharajObjectionable comments about Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj appeared on Wikipedia days after the release of Chhaava, a Bollywood film starring Vicky Kaushal, based on the life of the second Chhatrapati of the Maratha Empire.
Enema, anytime? DIY kits for constipation relief are viralWhat to do when life is complicated, uhm sorry, constipated? Use at-home enema kits, apparently.

After bail, Rahul Gandhi exempted from court presence in Savarkar defamation caseCongress MP Rahul Gandhi was permanently exempted from appearing in a Pune court in a defamation case against him over his alleged remarks on Hindutva ideologue Veer Savarkar. He got bail last month.

Delhi stampede: Conflicting accounts expose critical communication gapsThe starkly conflicting versions from the Railways, Railway Protection Force (RPF), and Delhi Police about what happened on the night of Delhi stampede not only raise serious questions about the chain of command, but also highlight a significant communication gap among the agencies responsible for managing the station.

Prosecution seeks death penalty for 1984 riots convict: Rarest of rare crimeThe prosecution has sought the death penalty for ex-Congress leader Sajjan Kumar, convicted last week for killing two Sikhs in the 1984 riots, calling it graver than Nirbhaya as it targeted an entire community.

Nicole Kidman-Keith Urban's Los Angeles home burglarised: ReportActor Nicole Kidman and her husband Keith Urban's Beverly Hills mansion was reportedly broken into over the weekend. The couple was not home, and it remains unclear if anything was stolen.

Why Rashmika Mandanna was a bad fit to play Yesubai in Vicky Kaushal's ChhaavaRashmika Mandanna's performance as Maharani Yesubai Bhonsale in the recent period drama Chhaava, has been receiving a lot of criticism after its theatrical release on February 14, 2025. In this piece, we discuss why her performance was underwhelming.

How Vicky Kaushal became Chhaava: Sword training, horse riding and daily scarsVicky Kaushal trained for six months for Chhaava, enduring 6–8 hours of daily prep, including sword fighting and horse riding. The historical drama has crossed Rs 165 crore in five days at the box office.

Sivakarthikeyan recreates Rajinikanth's steps in transformation video for AmaranActor Sivakarthikeyan recreated Rajinikanth's hook steps from Petta song. Recently, a video of the actor's physical transformation for Amaran was unveiled.

sports.headline: New Zealand has squad depth for Champions Trophy despite injuries: BondDespite injury setbacks, Shane Bond believes New Zealand's squad depth remains strong, emphasising their all-rounders' impact and confidence from recent triumphs ahead of the Champions Trophy opener against Pakistan in Karachi on February 19.

Fully fit Novak Djokovic handed shock Qatar Open exit by Matteo BerrettiniNovak Djokovic's struggles in 2025 continued as he suffered a shocking Round of 32 defeat to Matteo Berrettini at the Qatar Open. The Italian dominated after a tiebreak first set to claim a 7-6 (4), 6-2 win.

This comprehensive guide ensures you stay informed about all key aspects of the tournament.

Defending champions Pakistan face big test vs in-form New Zealand todayChampions Trophy: Pakistan recently lost the tri-series final to New Zealand, but will be looking to make amends when the two teams face each other on February 19 at National Stadium in Karachi.

Dream Champions Trophy chance: Viral Pakistani bowler relishes toe-crushers to RohitChampions Trophy 2025: In an interview with Sports Today, fast bowler Awais Ahmad talked about living his dream while bowling to Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma during the Indian net session.

Pakistan vs New Zealand live streaming: Champions Trophy opener complete guide Champions Trophy 2025, Pakistan vs New Zealand: Defending champions Pakistan face familiar foes New Zealand on Wednesday in the first match of the tournament, which returns after 8 years. It's a crucial match for the hosts ahead of their big game against India on Sunday.

Tom Latham braces for 'cracking' Champions Trophy opener vs Pakistan Champions Trophy: Tom Latham said that he is expecting for a cracker of a game when New Zealand lock horns with Pakistan on February 19 at the National Stadium in Karachi.

All-round Nat Sciver Brunt powers MI to crushing win over Gujarat GiantsWPL 2025: Nat Sciver Brunt put in an all-rounder performance as the Mumbai Indians (MI) beat the Gujarat Giants (GG) by five wickets on Tuesday at the Kotambi Stadium in Vadodara.

Champions Trophy preview and team ratings: Are India the favourites?The Champions Trophy returns to the cricket calendar after eight years, marking a significant moment for Pakistan, which hosts a major ICC event for the first time in 29 years. Eight teams will compete for the prestigious title, once famously dubbed the mini-World Cup.

New Zealand won't rush Rachin Ravindra's recovery for Pakistan openerChampions Trophy 2025: Wicketkeeper-batter Tom Latham, speaking to the press in Karachi on Tuesday, said New Zealand are wary of Rachin Ravindra's head injury and will not rush his recovery for the opening match on Wednesday.

Mohammed Siraj goes on Umrah trip ahead of Champions Trophy Indian fast bowler Mohammed Siraj embarked on a spiritual journey to Masjid Al Haram in Saudi Arabia ahead of the Champions Trophy, set to begin on February 19.

Tom Latham braces for 'cracking' Champions Trophy opener vs Pakistan Champions Trophy: Tom Latham said that he is expecting for a cracker of a game when New Zealand lock horns with Pakistan on February 19 at the National Stadium in Karachi.

All-round Nat Sciver Brunt powers MI to crushing win over Gujarat GiantsWPL 2025: Nat Sciver Brunt put in an all-rounder performance as the Mumbai Indians (MI) beat the Gujarat Giants (GG) by five wickets on Tuesday at the Kotambi Stadium in Vadodara.

Eight teams will compete for the prestigious title, once famously dubbed the mini-World Cup.

New Zealand won't rush Rachin Ravindra's recovery for Pakistan openerChampions Trophy 2025: Wicketkeeper-batter Tom Latham, speaking to the press in Karachi on Tuesday, said New Zealand are wary of Rachin Ravindra's head injury and will not rush his recovery for the opening match on Wednesday.

Mohammed Siraj goes on Umrah trip ahead of Champions Trophy Indian fast bowler Mohammed Siraj embarked on a spiritual journey to Masjid Al Haram in Saudi Arabia ahead of the Champions Trophy, set to begin on February 19.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
